projects.title: Basketball, The Natural Prediction
projects.text: For this project, me and my team thought ”if nature choose the natual selection to evolve things, why shouldn't we?” So we built a natural selection in python from scratch, without any librarys of IA, to help us predict the result of games using data from past games.

projects.title: WikiSpeed, The daily game of links
projects.text: In this game you start in a wikipedia page and you have to get in another specified page just through the links. You can play this game in this link  ---> wikispeed.vercel.app <---

projects.title: Netflix, the return of the clone
projects.text: For this project, I wanted to pratice my CSS, so I choose a site that most of people know the style and tried to copy it design.

experience.title: Lince, The growing local company
experience.text: Lince was responsible for make the tecnology for the two biggest factories of my city, and I used a mix of Java, Javascript, and CSS inside another language called xseed that was an is a cobol to java migration language. I stayed 6 months there, and left to pursue something more new.

experience.title: SCI - Sistemas contábeis
experience.text: SCI is a company that makes accounting systems for people and for others companies, I worked making maintence with them for 1 year, worked with Delphi, but was not my favorite stack. But was a great first experience.

habilities.title: Edition
habilities.text: Editing, both video and images, is one of my hobbies for the last 8 years, and I learned a lot in this time. in the matter of technology, I have experience with Sony Vegas and Davince Resolve for videos, and Photoshop and Illustrator for images.

habilities.title: Maybe its just that
habilities.text: I thought that I would have more to say. Sorry for creating a new session just for that.
